member.name: T:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.IModelItemOutOfSyncPropertyValueProvider
member.summary:
This will hint code that builds a workflow tree based on ModelItem hierarchy to query the internal Activity object for property values instead of using its own presentation level values. This is necessary when the backing Activity alters the value internally
Example: The ModelItem on the presentation level contains a password in clear, while the backing Activity stores it encrypted
Note that Microsoft forbids altering the value at backing data level, as the ModelItem gets out of sync and it doesn't receive any notification See MSDN

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.IModelItemOutOfSyncPropertyValueProvider.GetOutOfSyncPropertyValue(System.String)
member.summary:
Builds a dictionary with the properties that are susceptible to get out of sync with the wrapping ModelItem.
Any property that is not listed here is considered in sync.

member.name: T:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.ModelItemOutOfSyncPropertyValue
member.summary:
Wrapper around the property value. The wrapped value can be null.
This class acts as a Nullable Reference Types (Optional) that is expected in c# 8.0 See

member.name: T:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.CommonScenarios.ContextArgument
member.summary: Abstract definition of an activity argument. It can refer to an actual In/Out argument property or just a definition of an expression with a name attached to it.

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.CommonScenarios.ContextArgument.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Construct a static argument that is not processed at runtime because we already set its expression value. This is useful for containers where inner arguments value are generated at runtime where we know exactly their names. Also can be used to expose object information (e.g. for MailCard we can have argument named "Mail Subject" with expression "CurrentMail.Subject". This arguments can not be binded automatically.
member.param: Argument name. This sould be a used friendly name, it will just be displayed in UI.
Argument expression, must be a valid expression.
Type of the result.
Metadata for . Used to tell scenarios more information about e.g. a string that we know is actually a file path.

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.CommonScenarios.ContextArgument.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a dynamic argument definition that reads the argument expression at design time. If there is no expression a binding will automatically be generated.
member.param: Argument name. This sould be a used friendly name, it will just be displayed in UI.
Path to the activity argument. e.g. activity A has the argument OutArg1, the should be "OutArg1".
Metadata for argument. Used to tell scenarios more information about argument e.g. a string that we know is actually a file path.

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.CommonScenarios.ScenarioDefinition.FindMatchingArguments(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{UiPath.Activities.Contracts.CommonScenarios.ScenarioArgument})
member.summary: Extracts usable arguments from the context trace. Should return the first set of usable arguments found in the trace. If mode than 1 set of arguments is found this should return the first set. E.g. if a scenario processes arguments of type string there are 6 arguments of type string in the trace it should return only the first arguments it finds.

member.name: T:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.InvokeWorkflowRefactoring
member.summary: These members are used only for Windows implementations. Because UiPath.Activities.Contracts sometimes is loaded with it's Windows version for Portable projects we should provide a default implemetation for these methods. So don't put abstract members inside this class, only virtual.
Abstract class that is used to provide invoke workflow capabilities.

member.summary: Attempts to create an invocation activity for the given workflow.
member.param: The workflow to invoke

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.InvokeWorkflowRefactoring.TryCreateInvokeActivityWithArguments(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Activities.Argument})
member.summary: Attempts to create an invocation activity for the given workflow file. If not overridden by the derived type, fallbacks to creating an invoke activity without arguments.
member.param: The workflow to invoke
A dictionary of arguments to pre-populate in the invocation activity. The key is the name of the argument, the value is the argument itself.

member.name: T:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ResourceActionFactory
member.summary: Factory that produces action handlers for resources.

member.name: P:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ResourceActionFactory.RequiredServices
member.summary: List of services needed by the action handlers that this factory can produce. Services are identified by ids from . We need to identify them this way so that we can check compatibility for different versions of Studio and packages without making the runtime throw any errors in case of missing interfaces.

member.summary: Factory for resources stored as expressions in variables.

member.summary: For expression resource type this contains the definition of the resource constructor and its arguments. For activity resource types this is null.

member.name: T:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ResourceServicesTypes
member.summary: Supported service types that will be registerd by the host. We use string constants to identify services so that .Net Framework does not crash when we are loading mismatched versions of Studio and packages. This allows us to safely check what services are suported by resources registerd from packages and avoid loading mismatched resource factories/handlers.

member.name: T:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ResourceActionServices
member.summary: Global class containing services which are intended to be used by resource action handlers.

member.summary: Registers a service using the specified key. If the key is already used it will be updated.

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ResourceActionServices.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the service associated with the specified key. Returns null if no service is found.

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ResourceActionServices.Resolve``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the service associated with the specified key and casts the result to the specified type. Will return null if no service is associated with the specified key.

member.summary: Validate the specified resource name and returns null if it is valid. If it is invalid will return a validation error code from .

member.summary: Generates a valid resource name based on the specified seed.

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ExpressionResourceServiceBase.RenameResource(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Renames the specified resource. If the new name is invalid will return a validation error code from .

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ExpressionResourceServiceBase.ExpandString(System.String)
member.summary: Expands the given string expression.

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ExpressionResourceServiceBase.GenerateDynamicString(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a dynamic expression string based on the specified value. For example, if the given string is a file path that that is user-specific (e.g. a file path that points to something in My Documents), then this will turn that static string into a dynamic expression that can be "expanded" by at design time and evaluated by WWF at runtime, and that is user agnostic. It turns "C:\Users\SomeUser\SomeFolder" to something like string.Format("{}\SomeFolder", Environment.UserFolder).

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.ExpressionResourceServiceBase.GetDynamicStringPreview(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the preview if a generated dynamic expression. This is a user friendly localized text.

member.name: P:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.NetFramework.ProjectResources.TypeConstructorDefinition.ConstructorArgumentsMap
member.summary: List of constructor arguments in the order that we expect to find them in the type definition. It is stored as a list of . is our internal id we give to the argument, in the current implementation it is the name of the property of the local object mapped to this constructor arguments. is the constructor argument name.

member.name: T:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Refactorings
member.summary: These members are used only for Windows implementations. Because UiPath.Activities.Contracts sometimes is loaded with it's Windows version for Portable projects we should provide a default implemetation for these methods. So don't put abstract members inside this class, only virtual.

member.name: M:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Refactorings.GetModelItemCollectionOfCommentedActivities(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns the ModelItemCollection of all activities inside CommentOut given the ModelItem of a commented activity. Using "object" for all types because true types are not available on net5.0 and net6.0.
member.param: The ModelItem of an activtiy inside CommentOut

member.name: T:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys
member.summary: Collection of keys used by UiPath.Shared.Activities.MetadataInfoAttribute

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.ShowOnlyClear
member.summary: Applied to activity argument properties. Instructs autocomplete menu providers to provide only the option Clear for the specified property. This option will be inlined in the expression textbox.

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.ShowAssignToOptions
member.summary: Applied to activity argument properties. Instructs autocomplete menu providers to provide only the options specific to 'Save for later' functionality, which include: UseSavedValues, SaveForLater, but also compatible options like: ClearValue and AdvancedEditor.

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.RealType
member.summary: Applied to activity argument properties. Provides property editors/autocomplete menu providers with specific information about the property type. E.g. for a property of type DateTime we might say it actually contains only or only .

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.Include
member.summary: Applied to activity argument properties. Instructs property editors about what information is editable. E.g. for a property, the editor assumes we want to edit only hours, minutes and seconds, but for some properties we might wan to include or .

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.DisableExternalTools
member.summary: Applied to activity properties for which we don't want any external tools to show up in helpers or editors

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.Exclude
member.summary: Applied to activity argument properties. Instructs property editors about what information is not editable. E.g. for a property, the editor assumes we want to edit only hours, minutes and seconds, but for some properties we might want to exclude . or .

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.RequiredPackage
member.summary:
Applied to complex scenarios. Instructs scenario service to hide scenarios that are not compatible with the current project packages. The value for this key has to be in the following format: "packageId=packageVersion" - packageId is the id of the package, e.g. UiPath.Mail.Activities - packageVersion is the version of the package in the NuGet package version range format. Bellow you can see a section of the documentation:
Notation, Applied rule, Description
1.0 => x 1.0 => Minimum version, inclusive
(1.0,) => x > 1.0 => Minimum version, exclusive
[1.0] => x == 1.0 => Exact version match
(,1.0] => x 1.0 => Maximum version, inclusive
(,1.0) => x 1.0 => Maximum version, exclusive
[1.0,2.0] => 1.0 x 2.0 => Exact range, inclusive
(1.0,2.0) => 1.0 x 2.0 => Exact range, exclusive
[1.0,2.0) => 1.0 x 2.0 => Mixed inclusive minimum and exclusive maximum version
(1.0) => invalid => invalid
For more details please check https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/concepts/package-versioning#version-ranges

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.DropdownOptions
member.summary: Used to customize the content of the StudioX dropdown

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.UserNotification
member.summary: Metadata key for the action performed by an activity Should be used on the property identifying the target of the action

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.AssociatedAutoCompleteOptions
member.summary: Metadata key used to attach autocomplete options to an existing autocomplete options. They are not visible in ui but will be applied when the parent autocomplete option is applied. This is used to updated dependent properties values.

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.IsLinkedToActivityGenericTypeArgument
member.summary: Metadata key used to flag the properties that are synchronized with the argument type of a generic activity. E.g. we have generic activity "GenericActivity<T>" and its property "LinkedProperty" of type "IList<T>". In an workflow we have it as "GenericActivity<int>" and its property "LinkedProperty" of type "IList<int>". When the property has this metadata, the autocomplete service will allow any IList<T> to be assigned to "LinkedProperty" and will change the activity type to match the new value, for example it will allow the user to select a value of type "IList<string>" and will change the activity type in the workflow to "GenericActivity<string>".

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.CustomActivityContainer
member.summary: Metadata key used to mark an entity as a custom activity container For StudioX: draw the sequences contained by this container using business style

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.EnforceSequenceVisibility
member.summary: Metadata key used by an activity to enforce the visibility of it's sequences (aka ensure that the hide sequences feature does not apply for it's sequences).

member.name: F:UiPath.Activities.Contracts.Services.MetadataInfoKeys.ExcludeFromActivityOutputs
member.summary: Metadata key used by an activity to not show the outputs to the user

member.summary: Identifies Date part from a DateTime value.

member.summary: Identifies Time part from a DateTime value.
